name: Forward Shoulder Rotation
how_to_perform:
# Forward Shoulder Rotation
1. Stand in a neutral position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold your arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height, palms facing down.
3. Rotate one arm forward and upward while keeping it straight, so that your palm faces forward.
4. Engage your core and maintain good posture as you rotate your upper body towards the front.
5. Hold for a brief moment (about 1-2 seconds) to stretch your shoulder joint and surrounding muscles.
6. Slowly return your arm back to its starting position.
7. Repeat on the other side with the opposite arm.
short_summary: Forward Shoulder Rotation is an exercise that targets the shoulders, promoting flexibility and relaxation in the shoulder joint.
